sunchao commented on issue #4450: ARROW-5463: [Rust] Add AsRef trait for Buffer.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4450#issuecomment-498128962
 
 
   I think the problem is the `u8` case which will cause a conflict. As an alternative, we can instead implement a function similar to the existing `data`, but returns an slice of `T` instead of `u8`:
   ```rust
   pub fn typed_data<T: ArrowNativeType>(&self) -> &[T] { ... }
   ```
   
   This will save from the macros and in terms of usage it should be similar.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

liurenjie1024 commented on issue #4450: ARROW-5463: [Rust] Add AsRef trait for Buffer.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4450#issuecomment-498153648
 
 
   @sunchao There are two conflict cases.
   
   1. AsRef<[u8]> will add another From implementation for Buffer, since we already have `impl<T: AsRef<[u8]>> From<T> for Buffer` implementation.
   2. I don't how to implement AsRef<[bool]> for Buffer since the implementation logic is not trivial.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

sunchao commented on issue #4450: ARROW-5463: [Rust] Add AsRef trait for Buffer.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4450#issuecomment-498494956
 
 
   @liurenjie1024 In that case maybe you can change the above code to:
   ```rust
   pub fn typed_data<T: ArrowNativeType + num::Num>(&self) -> &[T] { ... }
   ```
   
   The problem against macros is that whenever someone adds a new type he/she needs to know all the places to modify to cover the places that the type is used.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

   Hmm.. why is that? this only happens if you implement `AsRef[u8]` for `Buffer` right? if you use the `typed_data` approach you should not need it.
